reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Early Childhood Care and Development

description.narrative: The project supports the provision of early childhood care and development support to children (0-8 years) in Oromiya and SNNP Region.ECCD services are accessible to around 21.6 % of Ethiopian children only and these services are concentrated in big cities and towns with low coverage in rural areas.The limited available services are unaffordable to the poor and not friendly to children with disabilities. This means, children from families with low socio-economic status, orphans and children with disabilitie s are denied the right to early child care and learning and less likely to benefit from the existing services. The ECCD project in Ethiopia establishes and supports low cost and community managed ECCD centers and enrolls children (ages 4-6) to early childh ood education programs that promote cognitive, social, emotional and physical development. It also enhances the skills, knowledge and attitude of parents and guardians and the community and schools to support children?s development from birth to eight year s. The primary beneficiaries of the project are children (0-8years), as well as parents, guardians in 8 Kebeles (smallest administrative unit of Ethiopia) in Toke Kutaye and Bolososorie Districts of Oromiya and SNNP regions respectively. RATSAN (national N GO) is the implementing local partner, working in close collaboration with District Education office. The overall project implementation is led by Plan International Ethiopia
